publication.abstract: Â© 2015 Pleiades Publishing, Ltd. Comparative analysis of structures of complexes of homologous proteins with DNA is important in the analysis of DNA-protein recognition. Alignment is a necessary stage of the analysis. An alignment is a matching of amino acid residues and nucleotides of one complex to residues and nucleotides of the other. Currently, there are no programs available for aligning structures of DNA-protein complexes. We present the program StructAlign, which should fill this gap. The program inputs a pair of complexes of DNA double helix with proteins and outputs an alignment of DNA chains corresponding to the best spatial fit of the protein chains.
publication.title: StructAlign, a program for alignment of structures of DNA-protein complexes

summary.description: Program for alignment of structures of DNA-protein complexes.
summary.name: StructAlign
